body:
I ran the following code from the renderer process

```js
require('electron').remote.getCurrentWebContents().executeJavaScript('console.log(\'foo\')')
```

And the console log appeared as expected, can you provide a minimal repro, it may be a timing issue in your code introduced by a timing change in the C66 upgrade.

Please @ mention me once a repro is provided for follow up ðŸ‘
@luca-viggiani Can you please check the issue with `3.0.0-beta.2` which was released yesterday? Thanks!
Just checked, same result as beta.1
@MarshallOfSound sorry I didn't read your last sentence and forgot to mention you...

issue.title: fix: remove race condition for executeJavaScript

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
Replaces 'did-finish-load' with 'did-stop-loading' which semantically
maps to the events inside Chromium.  Before I think we were relying
on a natural 99% winnable race condition.

Fixes #13504

refs: https://cs.chromium.org/chromium/src/content/browser/web_contents/web_contents_impl.cc?type=cs&g=0&l=4985
